official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from implementing proposed policy changes that would
			 permit passengers to carry small, non-locking knives on aircraft.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Keep Knives Out of Our Skies Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keep Knives Out of Our Skies Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Prohibition on implementation of policy change to permit small, non-locking knives on aircraft

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not implement any change to the
			 prohibited items list of the

that
			 would permit passengers to carry small, non-locking knives through
			 passenger screening checkpoints at airports, into sterile areas at
			 airports, or onboard passenger aircraft.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, on and after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

term.#tail:
means the list of items passengers are prohibited from carrying as accessible property or on their
			 persons through passenger screening checkpoints at airports, into sterile
			 areas at airports, and onboard passenger aircraft pursuant to section
			 1540.111 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on January
			 1, 2013).

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4368 IH: Keep Knives Out of Our Skies Act
